lines.content: * Custom exception class for Bond Forger chatbot error messages.
* Used to display user-friendly error messages when invalid commands or inputs are provided.
* Constructs a new Bark exception with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message to display to the user
* Main class to run Bond Forger chatbot. This chatbot allows users to manage tasks
* including ToDo items, Deadline tasks, and Event tasks. Tasks are persisted to
* a data file and loaded when the program starts.

*
  • deadline [description] /by [date time] - Add a new Deadline task

*
  • event [description] /from [date time] /to [date time] - Add a new Event task

*
  • unmark [number] - Mark a task as not completed
* Date format: d/M/yyyy HHmm (e.g., "3/2/2026 1430" for February 3, 2026 at 2:30 PM)
* Main method that runs the Bond Forger chatbot.
* Loads tasks from the data file, processes user commands interactively,
* and saves tasks back to the data file when the program exits.
* @throws IOException If there is an error reading from or writing to the data file
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
Task t = new Event(start, end, description);
throw new Bark("That task number does not exist.");
System.out.println("Woof! I have marked this task as done:");
throw new Bark("That task number does not exist.");
System.out.println("Woof! I have marked this task as undone:");
throw new Bark("Please specify which task to delete.");
throw new Bark("That task number does not exist.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + library.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + library.size() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + library.size() + " tasks in the list.");
Task t = new Event(start, end, description);
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + library.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new Bark("Bark Bark intruder alert!");
+ "Woof. Hope to see you again soon!\n"
* Represents a Deadline task, which is a task with a specific due date and time.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the given description and due date/time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* @param by The due date and time for the task
* Gets the due date and time of the deadline task.
* @return The LocalDateTime representing when the task is due
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task
* Represents an Event task, which is a task that occurs during a specific time period.
* Constructs a new Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param start The start date and time of the event
* @param end The end date and time of the event
* @param description The description of the event task
public Event(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end, String description){
* Gets the start date and time of the event.
* @return The LocalDateTime representing when the event starts
* Gets the end date and time of the event.
* @return The LocalDateTime representing when the event ends
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* @return A string representation of the Event task
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* This is the base class for different types of tasks (ToDo, Deadline, Event).
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* The task is initialized as not completed (status = 0).
* @param description The description of the task
* Sets the completion status of the task.
* @param status The status to set (1 for completed, 0 for not completed)
* Gets the completion status as a string representation.
* @return "X" if the task is completed, " " (space) if not completed
* Gets the description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return A string representation of the task
* Represents a ToDo task, which is a simple task without any date or time constraints.
* Constructs a new ToDo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* @return A string representation of the ToDo task
